FuncDef:
The clock source cesacr command configures the clock source selection mode as manual or forcible clock source selection and specifies a clock source to be traced.
The default clock source selection mode is automatic clock source selection.
The default mode is automatic clock source selection.
CLIs: clock { manual | force } source cesacr slot <slotid> card <card-id> recovery-domain <domain-value>

ParaDef.Info:
Specify slot id.
The value is a string of 1 to 16, not case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies a subcard ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies the number of the clock recovery domain from which a clock source is extracted.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8.
The value ranges from 1 to 4 of the 16 E1 subcard.The value of the former 16 interfaces of the 32 E1 subcard ranges from 1 to 4, and of the latter 16 interfaces ranges from 5 to 8.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] clock manual source cesacr slot 1 card 1 recovery-domain 2
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can run this command to manually or forcibly specify a clock source to be traced.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
When you forcibly specify a clock source, ensure that clock synchronization has been enabled on the specified clock source. If clock synchronization has not been enabled, the clock force source command does not take effect.If the status of a specified clock source is not normal or its SSM level is dnu, the system clock works in the hold state or free state.If the status of a manually specified clock source is neither normal nor holdoff, or its SSM level is not the highest, the clock manual source command does not take effect.
